alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan County through 745 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Black Mountain, or 10 miles east of Harlan, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Highsplint, Shields, Nolansburg and Pine Mountain around 705 PM EDT. Clover-Darby around 710 PM EDT. Black Bottom, Lejunior, Louellen, Closplint, Totz and Holmes Mill around 715 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Diane, Hiram, Clover Fork, Clover, Rock House, Lynch, Benham, Kingdom Come S.P., Clutts, Big Black Mountain, Cumberland and Blair. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
